plugins.name: Sentence case checker and converter
plugins.description:
Make your typography clean, consistent, and user-friendly.


Sentence Case Checker helps you scan all visible text layers in a selected frame and highlights any unintended capital letters mid-sentence — like those annoying This Is a Sentence errors.


✅ Detect sentence casing issues

✅ Shows all problematic phrases in a list

✅ Locate each error directly on canvas

✅ Convert individual words or fix all in one click

✅ Real-time refresh when changing selection


Supports UI writing best practices and editorial consistency!
plugins.tagline: Automatically detect and fix mid-sentence capitalization issues in your Figma designs.

130908.name: Sentence case checker and converter
130908.description:

✅ Convert individual words or fix all in one click

Supports UI writing best practices and editorial consistency!
130908.release_notes:
Improved sentence casing logic:
– Capitalized words after ., ?, or ! are no longer incorrectly flagged.
– Better handling of sentence boundaries to reduce false positives.
This update makes the plugin smarter and more accurate for real-world content.
130908.tagline: Automatically detect and fix mid-sentence capitalization issues in your Figma designs.

plugins.name: CSS Variables to Figma
plugins.description:
Import css variables into Figma variables

This plugin enables you import color variables from CSS into Figma, supporting both single-mode and dual Light/Dark mode setups. It maps your CSS variables to Figma's variable modes, converting formats like OKLCH (Tailwind), HEX, RGBA, and RGB into Figma-compatible HEX values. OKLCH, P3, and HCT color values are also preserved and attached to each variable for reference.


Example:


.light {
--color-primary: #000;
}
.dark {
--color-primary: #fff;
}


How it works:

  1. Paste your CSS variables in the text area below.
  2. Click "Export to JSON" to generate a Figma-compatible variables file.
  3. Import the JSON file into Figma using the Figma Variables by Honza Toman


Watch video→ how it works.


Currently supported:

  1. Color variables
  2. Attach oklch, p3 colors and HCT values to variable syntax


Next updates:

  1. Border radius variables
  2. Spacing variables
  3. Shadows
  4. ...


Feedback and support

  1. Let us know your feedback and suggestions! @sans_sherif
  2. Support the development of this plugin buy us a coffee ☕
plugins.tagline: Import existing css variables to figma variables

plugins.name: Your AI Co-Pilot
plugins.description:
Your AI Co-Pilot provides instant design feedback directly within Figma. Select any design elements to receive AI-powered analysis across four key areas:


• UI Design: Visual hierarchy, color usage, spacing, and consistency

• Content: Readability, clarity, and copy suggestions

• User Experience: Usability issues and interaction patterns

• Accessibility: WCAG compliance recommendations


The plugin analyzes selected frames, components, or groups and generates actionable feedback to improve your designs. You can ask follow-up questions to get more detailed explanations or recommendations.


All analysis is performed securely through our backend API using advanced AI models. No design data is stored permanently - it's only processed temporarily during analysis.
plugins.tagline: Instant AI feedback on your designs

129161.tagline: Instant AI feedback on your designs

plugins.name: Dummy datazer
plugins.description:
The Dummy datazer plugin enhances your Figma design workflow by allowing you to replace text in selected text layers with randomly generated data. With this plugin, you can effortlessly populate your designs with realistic placeholders, including:


- Full Names : Choose from a diverse list of 100 full names.

- Company Names : Select from 50 company names.

- Addresses : Utilize 50 unique addresses for location-based designs.

- Phone Numbers : Insert 50 different phone numbers for contact information.

Simply select the text layers you wish to update, choose the type of data you want to insert, and let the plugin do the rest. The Dummy datazer ensures your designs are filled with dynamic and varied content, perfect for mockups and testing scenarios.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly Populate Your Designs with Dynamic Data

plugins.name: Publish Ninja - Publish websites directly from Figma
plugins.description:
Turn your designs into live websites directly from Figma!

With Publish Ninja, you can instantly turn your Figma designs into fully functional, responsive websites directly from Figma.


🎉 Try it free! - We offer a 7-day free trial so you can experience publishing directly from Figma.


Why use Publish Ninja?

You’ve designed a website in Figma, but now you’re stuck. Either you need a developer, or you have to wrestle with complicated website builders. It’s frustrating, time-consuming, and slows you down.


Publish Ninja lets you publish fully responsive websites directly from Figma—no coding needed. With just a few clicks, your design goes live as a website.


⚡ How it Works

  1. Design in Figma – Create your site just like any other Figma project.
  2. Customize responsiveness – Easily adjust layouts for mobile, tablet, and desktop.
  3. Publish instantly – One click, and your website is live!


🔥 Why Choose Publish Ninja?


✅ No-Code website builder – No technical skills required.

✅ Live in seconds – Skip the hassle of exporting and coding.

✅ Custom domains – Publish on your own domain with ease.

✅ SEO-optimized – Built-in performance & search engine best practices.

plugins.name: Text to Frame Name
plugins.description:
The Figma plugin “Text to Frame Name” is a handy tool that allows you to replace selected text with the name of the highest-level frame it belongs to, all at once. This is particularly useful for page numbers in presentation materials or proposals. For example, you can set frame names with sequential numbers like “01,” “02,” and “03,” place temporary text (e.g., “00”) on each page, select all the text, and run this plugin to complete page numbering. Even if you reorder or add pages, you can easily reset the numbers by simply modifying the frame names. This eliminates the need for manual number adjustments, significantly improving workflow efficiency.


Figmaプラグイン「Text to Frame Name」は、選択したテキストを、それぞれが属する最上位のフレーム名に一括で置き換えることができる便利なツールです。主にプレゼンテーション資料や提案書などのページ番号で役立ちます。たとえば「01」「02」「03」など連番がついたフレーム名にしておき、各ページに仮のテキスト（例：00）を配置し、すべてのテキストを選択してこのプラグインを実行するだけで、ページ番号制作が完了します。ページを入れ替えたり追加したりしても、フレーム名さえ修正すれば簡単に番号を再設定可能。手動で番号を修正する必要がなくなり、作業効率が大きく向上します。
plugins.tagline: Auto-convert text layers to parent frame names

130123.description:

plugins.name: Variable Length Lorem Ipsum
plugins.description:
Most text generator plugins let you specify a single number for the word count. However, sometimes you want to specify a range instead, to introduce variability, and create more realistic results (realistic for lorem ipsum text, that is)


Features:

  1. Generates lorem ipsum text with the option of varied lengths.
  2. Enter a single number (e.g., "10") for fixed word count or a range (e.g., "5-10") for random variation within limits.
  3. Optionally add punctuation for generated text (default: off).
  4. Optionally auto-close the plugin after generating text (default: off).
  5. Supports your system setting for light or dark mode.
plugins.tagline: Specify a range of lengths for your lorem ipsum text

137731.release_notes: Fixed an issue where selected text nodes would change their resizing method when the text changed.
137731.tagline: Specify a range of lengths for your lorem ipsum text

plugins.name: Inflo-UX
plugins.description:
Introducing InFlo-UX – the prototype plugin for Figma (Adobe XD and Sketch to follow) that transforms your document content index into an interactive prototype.

InFlo-UX seamlessly ingests content index documents of all kinds, automatically creating numbered and labeled frames, all while retaining the project name, section titles, and page numbers.


Ideal for agencies and designers looking to streamline workflows,

InFlo-UX accelerates your design process by turning static content into an interactive, organized prototype with just a few clicks!
plugins.tagline: From Index to UX

138535.name: Variety corner
138535.description:
多样圆角（支持矩形和正多边形）

多效果预设：

▸ 倒角（切角）｜直角内凹（挤压）｜弧角内凹（凹陷）

全参数调控：

▸ 四角独立半径控制 + 内凹深度实时调节滑块


Variety Corners (Rectangles & Polygon)

Multiple Presets:

▸ Chamfer｜Right-Angle Inset｜Arc Inset

Precision Control:

▸ Independent corner radius + Real-time depth slider for inset styles
138535.release_notes:
新增了对figma工具中绘制的多边形的支持(仅支持正多边形，即绘制时边界框宽度高度相同)；

由于算法不同，多边形修改圆角类型后和矩形略有差异，具体表现为，插件会给多边形一个autolayout，同时锁定内部多边形，此时选中autolayout即可修改内部多边形。

Polygon Support: Added support for regular polygons (created with equal width and height).

How it Works: When a polygon's corner style is modified, it will be wrapped in a locked Auto Layout frame. To continue making edits with the plugin, simply select this new Auto Layout frame.
138535.tagline: 提供三种圆角样式 Provide extended corner styles

plugins.name: Chroma Forge
plugins.description:
Chroma Forge for Figma


A powerful color selection plugin for Figma that provides an intuitive color wheel and advanced color harmony tools to create consistent color palettes.


Features


Interactive Color Wheel

  1. High-precision color selection with a fully interactive color wheel
  2. Adjustable brightness and saturation sliders
  3. Real-time color preview
  4. HEX code input with validation


Color Harmony Tools

  1. Create cohesive color palettes using different harmony types:
  2. Analogous: Colors that are adjacent to each other on the color wheel
  3. Triad: Three colors evenly spaced around the color wheel
  4. Complementary: Colors opposite each other on the color wheel
  5. Split Complementary: A main color and two colors adjacent to its complement
  6. Square: Four colors evenly spaced around the color wheel
  7. Compound: A combination of complementary and analogous harmonies
  8. Mono: A single color with various shades
  9. Custom: Create your own custom harmony by placing markers freely


Flexible Color Selection

  1. Select 2-6 colors at once (depending on harmony type)
  2. Drag markers on the wheel to fine-tune your color selection
  3. Automatic contrast adjustment for optimal visibility


Figma Integration

  1. Apply selected colors directly to selected elements
  2. Create color styles from your palette
  3. Generate color variables with automatic shade variants (10% to 100% brightness)
  4. Intelligent naming system for organizing colors


How to Use


Select a Harmony Type: Choose from the dropdown menu to define how colors relate to each other

Select Number of Colors: Choose how many colors you want in your palette (2-6)

Choose Your Base Color: Click and drag on the color wheel or enter a HEX code

Adjust Saturation and Brightness: Use the sliders to fine-tune your colors

Apply Colors: Use the buttons to:

  1. Apply directly to selected elements
  2. Add to Figma color styles
  3. Add to Figma variables (with automatic shade creation)


Email me

Behance

Dribbble

LinkedIn

accepted.name: Andrei Kuznetsov
accepted.description: Templates, UI Kits, Design Systems, Plugins

plugins.tagline: Create perfect palettes with color harmony tools

plugins.name: Text Style Mapping
plugins.description:
Text Style Mapping simplifies the process of applying text styles to multiple text layers in your Figma designs.


Features:

  1. Apply text styles to both styled and unstyled text layers at once
  2. Automatically groups similar unstyled text based on font family, weight, size, and line height
  3. Switch between styled and unstyled text with an easy tab interface
  4. Works with your existing text styles library


How to use:

  1. Select a frame containing text elements
  2. Choose text styles from the dropdown menus
  3. Click "Apply Styles" to update all selected text layers at once


Note: This plugin may have limitations when working with text styles that use design tokens or local variables due to Figma API constraints.


This plugin helps maintain design consistency by making text styling quick and efficient across your Figma designs.


-


Text Style Mappingは、Figmaデザイン内の複数のテキストレイヤーにテキストスタイルを適用するプロセスを簡素化します。


機能：

  1. スタイル適用済みおよび未適用のテキストレイヤーに一度にスタイルを適用
  2. フォントファミリー、ウェイト、サイズ、行間に基づいて類似のスタイル未適用テキストを自動的にグループ化
  3. 使いやすいタブインターフェースでスタイル適用済みと未適用テキストを切り替え
  4. 既存のテキストスタイルライブラリと連携


使い方：

  1. テキスト要素を含むフレームを選択
  2. ドロップダウンメニューからテキストスタイルを選択
  3. 「Apply Styles」をクリックして、選択したすべてのテキストレイヤーを一度に更新


注意：このプラグインは、Figma APIの制約により、デザイントークンやローカル変数を使用するテキストスタイルでは制限がある場合があります。


このプラグインは、Figmaデザイン全体でテキストスタイリングを迅速かつ効率的に行い、デザインの一貫性を維持するのに役立ちます。
plugins.tagline: Batch apply text styles to multiple text layers in Figma.

plugins.description:

This plugin scans your entire file to identify and delete hidden layers, frames, and groups while respecting locked layers and hidden layers within master components. Streamline your workflow, optimize file performance, and maintain a clean, professional design environment with ease. Perfect for keeping your Figma files organized and efficient.

plugins.name: SupaFastPages
plugins.description:
This plugin helps designers and teams using Figma to automatically convert sections in a design into separate pages. This can be especially useful when you want to organise your Figma document by moving grouped content (like artboards or frames in a section) into new individual pages.


Key Features:

1. Convert Sections to Pages: The plugin scans the current Figma document and identifies sections (grouped content marked by Figma as "sections"). For each section it finds, the plugin creates a new page with the same name as the section or a default name if none is provided.

2. Move Children to New Pages: It transfers all the child nodes (like frames, components, and groups) inside the section to the newly created page. This helps in better organization and management of design files, where each section is neatly placed into its own page.

3. Remove Empty Sections: Once the children are moved to the new page, the original section is removed, leaving the workspace clean and organized.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly convert sections into organized pages for a cleaner Figma workspace.

109166.name: SupaFastPages
109166.description:
This plugin helps designers and teams using Figma to automatically convert sections in a design into separate pages. This can be especially useful when you want to organise your Figma document by moving grouped content (like artboards or frames in a section) into new individual pages.


Key Features:

1. Convert Sections to Pages: The plugin scans the current Figma document and identifies sections (grouped content marked by Figma as "sections"). For each section it finds, the plugin creates a new page with the same name as the section or a default name if none is provided.

2. Move Children to New Pages: It transfers all the child nodes (like frames, components, and groups) inside the section to the newly created page. This helps in better organization and management of design files, where each section is neatly placed into its own page.

3. Remove Empty Sections: Once the children are moved to the new page, the original section is removed, leaving the workspace clean and organized.
109166.release_notes:
1. UI Adjustments and Styling

•Dialog Box Sizing: Set the dimensions explicitly using figma.showUI(__html__, { width: 260, height: 320 }) in code.ts to ensure the interface displays without scrolling.
•Glassmorphic Background: Updated the container background to use a semi-transparent style with blur and shadow effects, enhancing the visual appeal.
•Font Updates: Applied SF Pro font styling to various elements to maintain a consistent and professional look.

2. Button Behavior Enhancement

•Dynamic Button Text: The Convert button initially displays “Select an Option” and is disabled. When the user selects either “Sections” or “Frames,” the text changes to “Convert,” and the button becomes enabled.
•Button Style Changes: Updated the styling of the disabled and enabled states of the button to use appropriate gradients and colors, making the active state more visually distinct.

3. Selection Feedback

•Option Selection Toggle: Added visual feedback for option selection. When “Sections” or “Frames” is selected, it highlights in red while the unselected option remains grey.
•Single Selection at a Time: Ensured that only one option can be selected at a time, with the other being deselected.

4. User Guidance

•Clear Instruction via Button: By changing the button text dynamically based on the selection, the update guides users through the necessary steps (selecting an option) before conversion, improving usability.
109166.tagline: Effortlessly convert sections into organized pages for a cleaner Figma workspace.

plugins.name: Notion Book Cover Formatter
plugins.description:
Notion Book Cover Formatter solves the common problem of adapting vertical book covers (typically in 2:3 ratio) to Notion's responsive format. Instead of struggling with manual resizing and background creation, this plugin automatically:

  1. Positions your book cover perfectly within the Notion image dimensions
  2. Creates a beautiful and consistent background from the original cover


Step by step instructions:

  1. Upload a book cover image
  2. Plugin creates a frame containing the formatted image
  3. Export the frame
  4. Upload to Notion as "Files & Media"
plugins.tagline: Notion-ready book covers with a single image upload

plugins.name: State Machines
plugins.description:
Create state machines and integrate them directly into your designs.


What is a state machine?


Think of a state machine as a way to organize all the different "states" your design can be in. For example, a form might have states like "empty," "filled," "submitting," or "error." State machines help you clearly define these states and the rules for moving between them, making complex interactions more manageable.


---


This plugin is experimental. Contributions and feature requests welcome: github.com/colebemis/figma-state-machines

accepted.name: Cole Bemis
accepted.description: Building things for people who build things. R&D at GitHub Next

plugins.tagline: Design complex interactions with state machines

plugins.name: Frame Duplicator
plugins.description:
Frame Duplicator is a plugin designed to help designers and social media managers quickly create multiple posts based on CSV data and images. Perfect for batch processing posts for social media, marketing, or any other repetitive content creation tasks.


In a sentence: Choose images and upload a CSV file listing the images and any text you’d like displayed. This plugin will read your CSV, duplicate a selected frame, and insert the specified images as the background along with the provided text in designated areas.


Key Features:

CSV Integration: Automatically populate frames with text fields such as titles and subtitles based on CSV data, making it easy to maintain consistent content across multiple designs.

Image Replacement: Efficiently replace images in frames based on file names specified in the CSV, allowing you to work seamlessly with visual content.

Aspect Ratio Preservation: Ensures that images maintain their aspect ratio when resized within frames, avoiding distortion or stretching.

Batch Frame Duplication: Create multiple frames with the click of a button, with each frame populated by unique data and images from your CSV.


How to Use:

Prepare CSV and Images: Make sure your CSV file includes columns for text fields (title and subtitle) and image filenames.


Your CSV column titles must be:

title, subtitle, imageName.


Select a Frame in Figma: Choose the frame you want to duplicate.


Your Frame must include text / rectangle elements titled:

##Title ##Image ##Subtitle


Upload CSV and Images: Load your CSV and corresponding image files through the plugin’s interface.

Create Frames: Click "Create Frames" to generate frames based on the CSV data, with each frame containing unique text and images row by row.
plugins.tagline: Duplicate frames with text and images based on CSV data for streamlined post creation

108356.name: Frame Duplicator
108356.description:

plugins.name: Twenty3 Template Tagging
plugins.description:
Export graphics for the Twenty3 Toolbox.


How to use:

  1. Start by installing the Twenty3 Template Tagging plugin from the Resources tab in Figma
  2. Select the Frame or Layer that you would like to export
  3. Check the preview in the plugin interface
  4. Click the export button in the plugin header to save the formatted SVG locally
  5. Upload the SVG at https://toolbox.twenty3.sport/graphic-editor using your Toolbox credentials


Technical details:

  1. SVG text elements are replaced with foreignObject elements so that text can be populated dynamically and manually in the Toolbox editor
  2. Figma's image rect elements are replaced with and image tag containing base64 encoded data


Notes:

  1. Font binding takes place in the Toolbox, so if you do not have the fonts downloaded to your device you will not see them in the preview
plugins.tagline: Software to format and export templates for the Twenty3 Toolbox

138969.name: Twenty3 Template Tagging
138969.description:

  2. Select the Frame or Layer that you would like to export
  3. Check the preview in the plugin interface
  4. Click the export button in the plugin header to save the formatted SVG locally
  5. Upload the SVG at https://toolbox.twenty3.sport/graphic-editor using your Toolbox credentials


Technical details:

  1. SVG text elements are replaced with foreignObject elements so that text can be populated dynamically and manually in the Toolbox editor
  2. Figma's image rect elements are replaced with and image tag containing base64 encoded data


Notes:

  1. Font binding takes place in the Toolbox, so if you do not have the fonts downloaded to your device you will not see them in the preview

plugins.name: Figma to BlocksIn System
plugins.description:
The BlocksIn System plugin for Figma is a game-changer for front-end development. Effortlessly convert Figma designs into React components, ready for implementation with our NPM package.


BlocksIn System - React Component Library


Here's how it simplifies your workflow:


  • Design: Create patterns using Figma components.
  • Generate: Select a frame and click 'Generate' to convert it into React markup.
  • Implement: Seamlessly integrate the code with BlocksIn System React components.
  • Reuse: Streamline your process by reusing design patterns.


Watch the video here.


Special thanks to my friend Eugenio who inspired this project. Check out his amazing work.


Get started with the BlocksIn System plugin and revolutionise your design-to-development process!
plugins.tagline: Transform Figma designs into React BlocksIn System components effortlessly.

plugins.name: Top'n'Fix
plugins.description:
Tired of constantly switching to the prototype panel to fix a layer or frame? With the Top'n'Fix plugin, you can easily bind it to the shortcut combination of shift+opt+cmd+] and accomplish it with a single click, saving you time and effort.

Key Features:

  1. Streamlined Fixing: Instantly fix any layer or frame without the need to navigate to the prototype panel.
  2. Efficient Shortcut: Assign the shift+opt+cmd+] shortcut to quickly apply fixes with a single keystroke.


Please note that at least one object should already be fixed on the screen, fixed area in layers must be created. Hope to fix it in next version.
plugins.tagline: Fix layer, bring to the front and fix, fix frame, fix in the prototype

135335.tagline: 🔥 7000+ Stylish Icons at Your Fingertips 🎨✨ Boost Your Designs with CoolRasto  🚀

plugins.name: AI Image Generator: Saifs AI
plugins.description:
AI Image Generator brings powerful text-to-image capabilities right into Figma. With just a prompt, you can:


Produce photorealistic or stylistic images in seconds


Adjust aspect ratio, style presets, and color palettes


Batch-generate up to 10 assets at once


Keep everything private—processing happens securely within your files


No external tools required: design, iterate, and refine without ever leaving Figma.

accepted.name: Saifs AI
accepted.description: AI tools to speed up and automate your creative and experience workflow.

plugins.tagline: Generate high-quality, customizable images from text prompts- integrated into your Figma workflow

networkAccess.reasoning: This plugin needs access to multiplewords.com for authentication, shorts.multiplewords.com for token information, api.openai.com for image generation, and multiplewords.nyc3.cdn.digitaloceanspaces.com for serving generated images.

131753.tagline: Generate high-quality, customizable images from text prompts- integrated into your Figma workflow

plugins.name: IT Buddy Maker
plugins.description:
This plugin lets you easily place adorable 3D character illustrations of team roles right onto selected Figma shapes.

Choose from designers, developers, PMs, and more – all in a charming 3D style.

A fun way to make your team feel more friendly and human in your designs!

accepted.name: kenny
accepted.description: I am a designer who creates the tools and experiences that users truly need. I believe good design goes beyond visuals, flow and development.

plugins.tagline: Turn your team into cute 3D characters!

plugins.name: Console CLI
plugins.description:
Console CLI lets you control Figma using commands. You can list fonts, styles, and components, create shapes, get details about selected elements, check file analytics, and view user info.


Commands:

  1. help : See available commands
  2. ls : Lists data related to fonts, styles, or components
  3. ls fonts : List all fonts used in the file
  4. ls styles : List all styles used in file file
  5. ls components : List all components in the file
  6. shape : Create a new shapes based on the specified type
  7. shape rect <width> <height> [x] [y] : Create rectangle
  8. shape circle <diameter> [x] [y] : Create circle
  9. shape ellipse <width> <height> [x] [y] : Create ellipse
  10. shape polygon <sides> <radius> [x] [y] : Create polygon
  11. shape star <points> <outer-radius> <inner-radius> [x] [y] : Create star
  12. selection : Info about the currently selected nodes
  13. selection --verbose : Additional details about the selection
  14. analytics : Retrieve file analytics
  15. whoami : Retrieves info about the current user
  16. clear : Clear the console
  17. exit : Close the plugin
plugins.tagline: CLI for Figma. List elements, create shapes, get selection info, and check file analytics.

127623.tagline: CLI for Figma. List elements, create shapes, get selection info, and check file analytics.

plugins.name: Section Navigator
plugins.description: Section Navigator helps you stay organized in large FigJam files by listing all top-level sections in your current page. You can easily jump between them or insert a visual index directly on the canvas for reference.
plugins.tagline: Quickly list and jump to top-level sections in your FigJam file.

125696.name: Section Navigator
125696.description: Section Navigator helps you stay organized in large FigJam files by listing all top-level sections in your current page. You can easily jump between them or insert a visual index directly on the canvas for reference.
125696.tagline: Quickly list and jump to top-level sections in your FigJam file.

plugins.name: Text Style Usage Analyzer
plugins.description: Analyze and visualize the usage of text styles in your Figma project. This plugin lists all text styles (even unused ones), sorts them by usage, and displays a bar chart next to each style. Green bars indicate high usage, yellow for medium, and red for zero usage. Perfect for cleaning up unused styles and optimizing your design system.
plugins.tagline: Text Style Usage Analyzer on your file

122816.name: Text Style Usage Analyzer
122816.description: Analyze and visualize the usage of text styles in your Figma project. This plugin lists all text styles (even unused ones), sorts them by usage, and displays a bar chart next to each style. Green bars indicate high usage, yellow for medium, and red for zero usage. Perfect for cleaning up unused styles and optimizing your design system.
122816.tagline: Text Style Usage Analyzer on your file
